content.rendered:
Table of Contents

  • I want to get bigger, more muscular, and/or stronger
  • I want to lose weight, get leaner, and/or be more toned looking
  • I want to get better at a specific lift
  • I have a specific look I want to achieve
  • I want to add exercise to my life but I’m having trouble getting started

Welcome to The Fitness Wiki!

There’s a lot of information to sort through in this Wiki and sometimes, this can be overwhelming. The goal of this Guided Tour page can be summed up with the following question:

If you could only give someone three to five pages to read to help them achieve their goals, what would they be?

Below are a series of the most commonly described goals that people come to r/Fitness for help with, and what we believe to be the best entries in the Wiki to read to learn how to achieve them.

So, dear reader, what best describes your primary goal?

I want to get bigger, more muscular, and/or stronger

  • Muscle Building 101
  • Strength Training / Muscle Building Routines
  • FAQ: How do I choose the right routine for my goals?
  • FAQ: How do I do a new lift? Do I need to learn from a trainer?
  • FAQ: Why can’t I gain weight?

I want to lose weight, get leaner, and/or be more toned looking

  • Weight Loss 101
  • FAQ: What is more important for weight loss – calories or macros?
  • FAQ: Why can’t I lose weight?
  • FAQ: What exercises can I do to lose fat in my [body part]?
  • FAQ: How do I get more toned / How do I tone my [bodypart]?

I want to get better at a specific lift

  • Learning and Improving Lifts
  • Weakpoint Wednesdays Archive
  • FAQ: I’m not making any progress – What can I do?

I have a specific look I want to achieve

  • Muscles and Muscle Groups
  • Weakpoint Wednesdays Archive
  • FAQ: I want to look like [actor/celebrity/picture], how should I diet and work out?
  • FAQ: What exercises can I do to lose fat in my [body part]?

I want to add exercise to my life but I’m having trouble getting started

  • Getting Started with Fitness
  • Adding Physical Activity
  • How can I get motivated to pursue fitness?
  • I don’t enjoy exercise / cardio / lifting. How can I learn to love it?
  • I feel self-conscious about going to the gym. What do I do?

jetpack-related-posts.title: Muscle Building 101
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Introduction There is an illusion of complexity to gaining weight and building muscle (perpetuated largely by people who want your money) but it is actually very straightforward. Your body requires a certain amount of energy (measured in calories) each day in order to fuel its activities. This is called your…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Welcome!
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: TheFitness.Wiki is the official wiki of r/Fitness and r/weightroom on Reddit. Its goal is to provide a high quality hub for information and advice about achieving physical fitness goals - compiled and organized from the best threads and advice from both communities. jetpack-related-posts.title: Getting Started with Fitness
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Before You Begin Just like any other activity, bettering your physical fitness can feel daunting - especially if the world of fitness is a completely new one to you. To help with this, before we dig in to the "What", it's important to lay some groundwork so that your head…

jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Here you'll find the most frequently asked questions on r/Fitness with the best, most commonly given answers. jetpack-related-posts.title: I'm not making any progress - What can I do?
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Unfortunately, there is no definitive answer to what is keeping you from making progress. Instead, you need to approach this from a trial and error and process of elimination perspective - there are a number of things that you can try to see if they have a positive effect. We're…
